# How to Add ChatGPT to your Website

## Train a custom bot that knows everything about your website to answer
visitor questions, provide support, and more!

James Futhey

·

Follow

3 min read

·

May 10, 2023

\--

1

Listen

Share

# What can ChatGPT do on your website?

Currently, you can use **SiteGPT.ai** **** to train a custom chatbot based on
everything on your website. So, if a visitor or potential customer visits your
product website or store, it can help them find what they are looking for, and
answer complex questions about anything covered on your website, or existing
help documentation.

When answering, our ChatGPT bot automatically pointed users to the appropriate
resources in addition to answering their question.

When a customer asks a question, it will even provide sources for where it
obtained the answer, so the user is pointed to the correct resource or guide
to fully answer their question.

We’ve trained **SiteGPT.ai** to cover all the content of our existing website,
and more!

# Why you might do this

There are lots of reasons to add ChatGPT to your website. For us, we wanted to
provide customer support outside of business hours, so we **Integrated ChatGPT
with our Crisp.chat messenger bot** to let users ask questions when we aren’t
around.

So, if a customer visits **www.meetingroom365.com** outside of business hours,
they can ask a question and get an instant reply covering anything in our help
documentation, FAQs, and other common questions we’ve trained our chat bot on.

There are a ton of other reasons why you might want to train a custom ChatGPT
bot on your website. So, let’s get into the details of how it’s done!

 **SiteGPT.ai** **** lets you create a custom bot for your website in just a
few minutes!

# What is SiteGPT.ai?

 **SiteGPT.ai** is the simplest way to index your website, FAQs, and Helpdesk
articles to provide live support to users on your website, even when you’re
not around.

It follows a three-step process. Simply sign up for a free trial of
**SiteGPT.ai**, enter the URLs of the pages you want to index, crawl your
website, and then embed the **SiteGPT.ai** **Chatbot** on your website using
the provided Javascript embed code.

To get started, head to your **SiteGPT.ai** **dashboard,** click **Links** ,
and **Fetch Additional Links**. You can use this to add additional web pages
to your bot’s knowledgebase. It even integrates with your website’s
**sitemap** to crawl everything at once, or popular documentation services
like **Zendesk** and **Gitbook**.

Once you enter a URL or resource, it will give you a list of pages linked from
that page, and the option to crawl each one. Then you can **start training**
on these pages to add these to your chatbot’s knowledgebase.

Once you’re finished, you can get the embed code to add the chatbot to your
website, from the main page of the dashboard.

You can get the embed code for your custom chat bot from the **SiteGPT.ai**
**dashboard**

Then, anyone who visits your website and interacts with the **SiteGPT.ai**
**Chatbot** can get instant answers on a variety of topics covered on your
website.
